### Creating an Account
<div class="forYouToDo" id="first"> 
<img class="imageRight" src="/img/sys/dialog-cloud-signup.png" alt="signing up for the cloud" title="signing up for the cloud"/> 
<ol>
<li>If you haven't already opened <span class="snap">snap</span>, open it now: <a href="http://snap.berkeley.edu/run" title="Snap! Build Your Own Blocks" target="_blank"><strong>http://snap.berkeley.edu/run</strong></a></li>
<li>
In the Snap<em>!</em> window, click the Cloud menu, <img src="/img/1-introduction/cloud_button.png" alt="Cloud menu button" title="Cloud menu button" />, select "Signup...", and follow the instructions. <br />
<img class="indent" src="/img/sys/button-cloud-with-context.png" alt="cloud icon" title="cloud icon"/>
</li>
<div class="endnote">
<p>You'll be asked to click a link in your email to verify your account, but you don't have to do that right now.</p>
<p>You may change your password at any time using the Cloud menu, <img src="/img/1-introduction/cloud_button.png" alt="Cloud menu button" title="Cloud menu button"/>.</p>
</div>
</ol>
</div>

### Logging In to and Out of Your Snap<em>!&nbsp;</a>Account
<div class="forYouToDo">
<p>You should be logged in whenever you are in Snap<em>!</em>. Here's how to check if you are logged in:</p>
<ol start="3">
<li>
Click the Cloud menu in the tool-bar.
<ul> 
<li><strong>If</strong> it says "Logout" and your user name, then you are already logged in.</li>
<li><strong>If</strong> it says someone else's user name, then log them out and log in with your own user name.</li>
<li><strong>Otherwise</strong>, choose "Login..." and enter your user name and password.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
Click NEXT (on the top right of this web page) to continue.
<div class="endnote">Remember to log out of Snap<em>!</em> (using the Cloud menu) when you are done.</div>
</li>
</ol>
</div>
